title: Business Council of Australia - Wikipedia
snippet: It was formed in 1983 by the merger of the Business Roundtable – a spin-off of the Committee for Economic Development of Australia – and the Australian Industry Development Association. The organisation is headquartered in Melbourne with offices in Sydney and Canberra.

title: Business Council of Australia
snippet: We bring together the expertise and influence of our members to strengthen the Australian quality of life and ensure more opportunities for all Australians. ... The Business Council of Australia drives the nation’s economic agenda, leveraging the expertise of Australia’s leading businesses to advocate for policy solutions that lift living standards for all Australians.
